results.title: The Man who fell to earth
results.creator_credit: British Lion Films, Michael Deeley, Barry Spikings and Nicolas Roeg
results.brief_description: David Bowie, plays The Stranger. Armed with a British passport, he arrives in New York but is in fact an alien from a dying planet, having studied earth habits from monitoring television. This hairless, sexless creature is eventually caught and handed over to a team of scientists and doctors for research. Nicolas Roeg’s technical brilliance is apparent in this weirdly voyeuristic science fiction fantasy which is at times emeshed in its convoluted plot. Co-starring Buck Henry as a patent lawyer who befriends The Stranger and reaps success from the acquaintance and Rip Torn as Professor Nathan Brycce, determined to discover the truth.

results.title: The Man who digs for fish
results.creator_credit: John Taylor, ONF | NFB and Jack Long
results.brief_description: Frank Jenkinson, eighty-two, has been digging for fish for twenty-five years. His unorthodox conservationist practices have increased the numbers of the salmon population in the Jarvis Inlet from a modest 500 to 25000. Using a spade and accompanied by his dog, Frank wades up and down the stream, digging for the newly hatched salmon that lie buried in the gravel. Without his intervention they risk dying before reaching maturity.

results.title: The Man who cried
results.creator_credit: Christopher Sheppard, Universal Pictures and Sally Potter
results.brief_description: Fegele (Christina Ricci) is a young girl living in a small Russian village with her father who decides to leave for America, promising to send for her as soon as he is able. Nazi troops arrive at the village, forcing Fegele to flee to England with relatives where she is adopted by a loving couple who rename her Suzie. An aspiring and gifted singer, Suzie leaves for Paris where she becomes a nightclub singer and meets Lola (Cate Blanchett). The girls commence work on a lavish opera production where Suzie meets Cesar (Johnny Depp), a poor gypsy horse trainer, and Lola meets Dante (John Turturro), the star of the opera whom she uses for his wealth and security. Suzie and Cesars short lived romance comes to an end with the Nazi occupation of France. Sally Potter, director of ‘The Tango lesson’ and ‘Orlando’ provides a lush and lavish film depicting the heartbreaking world of two souls destined for anguish.

results.title: The Man who can't stop
results.creator_credit: Film Australia, ONF | NFB, Tom Daly, Richard Mason and Michael Rubbo
results.brief_description: Tells of the efforts of Francis Sutton to save the Australian coastline from pollution. Dedicated to this task Sutton works ceaselessly on maps, diagrams and plans in an attempt to find an alternative to the disposal of sewage through ocean outfalls. Though receiving many rebuffs, gradually he is gaining support, from a scientist, politician and from the people who live around him. Cinematography by Don McAlpine.

results.title: The Man who came to dinner
results.creator_credit: Hal B Wallis, Warner Bros Pictures and William Keighley
results.brief_description: While on a lecture tour an acid-tongued celebrity (Whiteside) and his secretary accept a dinner invitation from the Stanleys. Unfortunately on arriving at the Stanley’s home, Whiteside slips on the ice and breaks his hip subsequently finding himself confined to the Stanley’s home. During his recuperation Whiteside manages to cause chaos and mayhem with his interfering and upsetting comments. Based on the Broadway hit by George S. Kaufman and Moss Hart, and adapted for the screen by Julius and Philip Epstein. Cast includes Bette Davis, Ann Sheridan, Monty Woolley, Jimmy Durante, Billie Burke, Reginald Gardiner.

results.title: The Man that gravity forgot
results.creator_credit: Auricom Van Gelber, Coronet and Wijnand Nieuwenkam
results.brief_description: An animated film about the life of Bram, the only person in the world who is not affected by the force of gravity. As Bram narrates this account of his gravity-free life he presents basic scientific information about gravity, and reveals the important role that this force plays in our lives.

results.title: The Man on the flying trapeze
results.creator_credit: William Le Baron, Paramount Pictures and Clyde Bruckman
results.brief_description: W.C. Fields plays Ambrose Wolfinger who is a very henpecked family man. Given no respect from his overbearing relatives including a picky mother-in-law, lazy brother-in-law and his bossy and nagging wife, Ambrose has a constant battle as everything seeming to be against him. His saving only grace is his daughter from a previous marriage and the workplace where he has a mild respect for his amazing memory. What happens when he wants to have an afternoon off to see a wrestling match is a series of mishaps where he finds himself out of a job and exiled by his family. This comedy of errors is an entertaining display of the art of Fields as a comedian. “The Man on the Flying Trapeze” is made up of a collection of short gags, almost short films in themselves, which make up the whole compelling feature. It is a fine farce of married life, in-laws and dysfunctional relationships where nothing ever goes right but is always funny. Cast also includes Mary Brian, Kathleen Howard and Lucien Littlefield.

results.title: The Man on the beat
results.brief_description: The duties and training of a London policeman, known over the world for his courtesy. The London policeman is unarmed, and his duties vary from finding lost children to directing traffic. Dealing with crime is only an occasional part of the ordinary London policeman’s job.

results.title: The Man on the assembly line
results.creator_credit: Nicholas Balla, Morten Parker and National Film Board of Canada
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Nature of Work”.
A dramatized look at a man who ultimately pays the price for the benefits associated with modern mass production - a worker in an automobile factory who performs one operation with relentless monotony so that the assembly line can keep moving at top efficiency.

results.title: The Man of the beatitudes
results.creator_credit: Vincenzo Labella, Franco Zeffirelli and Don Bosco Multimedia
results.brief_description:
Episode number 8 of Series “Jesus of Nazareth”.
The continuing story of the life of Jesus Christ from: in the olive grove Jesus sends his disciples off to their mission; John visits Mary the mother of Jesus; assault on Herod, the zealots manage to wound him; the Zealots arrested and killed in front of Herod’s palace; the Sermon on the Mount, the beatitudes, the Our Father; Peter tries to stop Jesus from going to Jerusalem; the crowds journey to Jerusalem for the festival; a messenger from Martha and Mary comes to Jesus; Jesus arrives at Bethany and learns that Lazarus has died; Martha and Mary convince Jesus to visit the tomb of Lazarus; Jesus raises Lazarus from the dead.
